intro: Helicophyllum luph, commonly known as the spiral leaf fern, is a unique plant characterized by its spiral arrangement of fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves that curl into a spiral pattern, aiding in moisture retention. Its rhizome system allows it to thrive in shaded, humid environments. Helicophyllum luph is often cultivated for its ornamental value and air-purifying properties.
